001package imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic;
002
003import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.isZero;
004import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
005
006import java.awt.geom.Point2D;
007import java.util.Locale;
008
009import org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.twod.Vector2D;
010
011import imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic;
012
013/** 
014 * Interface specifying the behavior of simple 2D points. 
015 * It is used to adapt to different (legacy) point implementations 
016 * with a common API. 
017 * To some extent this is similar to the functionality provided by
018 * {@link java.awt.geom.Point2D} and {@link java.awt.Point}
019 * but was re-implemented to avoid dependency on AWT and for
020 * more flexibility in naming and class structure.
021 * <br>
022 * Two concrete classes are defined for points with {@code double}
023 * and {@code int} coordinates, respectively.
024 * See {@link Pnt2d.PntDouble} and {@link Pnt2d.PntInt} for how
025 * to instantiate such point objects.
026 * 
027 */
028public interface Pnt2d {
029        
030        double getX();
031        double getY();
032        
033        // ----------------------------------------------------------
034        
035        public default double[] toDoubleArray() {
036                return new double[] {this.getX(), this.getY()};
037        }
038        
039        public default java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double toAwtPoint2D() {
040                return new java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double(this.getX(), this.getY());
041        }
042        
043        public default Vector2D toVector2D() {
044                return new Vector2D(getX(), getY());
045        }
046        
047        public default Pnt2d duplicate() {
048                throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
049        }
050        
051        // ----------------------------------------------------------
052
053        public default boolean equals(Pnt2d p) {
054                return isZero(this.getX() - p.getX()) && isZero(this.getY() - p.getY());
055        }
056        
057        // ----------------------------------------------------------
058        
059        public default double distance2(Pnt2d p) {
060                return sqr(this.getX() - p.getX()) + sqr(this.getY() - p.getY());
061        }
062        
063        public default double distance(Pnt2d p) {
064                return Math.sqrt(this.distance2(p));
065        }
066        
067        /**
068         * Immutable 2D point with {@code double} coordinates.
069         * This class implements the {@link Pnt2d} interface.
070         * <br>
071         * A public constructor ({@link #PntDouble(double, double)})
072         * is provided but the preferred way of instantiation is
073         * by one of the static factory methods, such as
074         * {@link #from(double, double)},
075         * {@link #from(double[])}, etc.
076         * <br>
077         * Access to the coordinate values is provided by the methods
078         * {@link #getX()} and {@link #getY()}, but the
079         * actual field variables {@link #x}, {@link #y} are also 
080         * publicly accessible (for better performance and less clutter).
081         */
082        public class PntDouble implements Pnt2d {
083                
084                public static final PntDouble ZERO = PntDouble.from(0, 0);
085
086                public final double x, y;
087
088                private PntDouble(double x, double y) {
089                        this.x = x;
090                        this.y = y;
091                }
092                
093                @Override
094                public double getX() {
095                        return x;
096                }
097
098                @Override
099                public double getY() {
100                        return y;
101                }
102                
103                @Override
104                public PntDouble duplicate() {
105                        return new PntDouble(this.x, this.y);
106                }
107                
108                @Override
109                public String toString() {
110                        return String.format(Locale.US, "%s[%.3f, %.3f]", 
111                                        getClass().getSimpleName(), x, y);
112                }
113                
114                // static factory methods
115                
116                public static PntDouble from(double x, double y) {
117                        return new PntDouble(x, y);
118                }
119                
120                public static PntDouble from(double[] xy) {
121                        return new PntDouble(xy[0], xy[1]);
122                }
123                
124                public static PntDouble from(Pnt2d p) {
125                        return new PntDouble(p.getX(), p.getY());
126                }
127                
128                public static PntDouble from(Point2D p) {
129                        return new PntDouble(p.getX(), p.getY());
130                }
131                
132                public static PntDouble from(Vector2D vec) {
133                        return new PntDouble(vec.getX(), vec.getY());
134                }       
135                
136        }
137        
138        // ----------------------------------------------------------
139        
140        /**
141         * Immutable 2D point with {@code int} coordinates.
142         * This class implements the {@link Pnt2d} interface.
143         * <br>
144         * A public constructor ({@link #PntInt(int, int)})
145         * is provided but the preferred way of instantiation is
146         * by one of the static factory methods, such as
147         * {@link #from(int, int)},
148         * {@link #from(int[])}, etc.
149         * <br>
150         * The {@code int} coordinates can only be retrieved via the
151         * publicly accessible field variables {@link #x}, {@link #y},
152         * while the methods {@link #getX()} and {@link #getY()}
153         * return {@code double} values for compatibility reasons.
154         * 
155         */
156        public final class PntInt implements Pnt2d {
157                
158                public static final PntInt ZERO = PntInt.from(0, 0);
159                
160                public final int x, y;
161                
162                public PntInt(int x, int y) {
163                        this.x = x;
164                        this.y = y;
165                }
166
167                @Override
168                public double getX() {
169                        return x;
170                }
171
172                @Override
173                public double getY() {
174                        return y;
175                }
176                
177                @Override
178                public PntInt duplicate() {
179                        return new PntInt(this.x, this.y);
180                }
181                
182                @Override
183                public String toString() {
184                        return String.format(Locale.US, "%s[%d, %d]", 
185                                        getClass().getSimpleName(), x, y);
186                }
187                
188                public boolean equals(Pnt2d p) {
189                        if (p instanceof PntInt) {
190                                return this.equals((PntInt) p);
191                        }
192                        else {
193                                return Arithmetic.isZero(this.x - p.getX()) && Arithmetic.isZero(this.y - p.getY());
194                        }
195                }
196                
197                public boolean equals(PntInt p) {
198                        return (this.x == p.x) && (this.y == p.y);
199                }
200                
201                // static factory methods --------------------------------------
202                
203                public static PntInt from(int x, int y) {
204                        return new PntInt(x, y);
205                }
206                
207                public static PntInt from(PntInt p) {
208                        return new PntInt(p.x, p.y);
209                }
210                
211                public static PntInt from(int[] xy) {
212                        return new PntInt(xy[0], xy[1]);
213                }
214                
215                public static PntInt from(Pnt2d p) {
216                        if (p instanceof PntInt) {
217                                return ((PntInt) p).duplicate();
218                        }
219                        else {
220                                throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot convert to " +
221                                                        PntInt.class.getSimpleName());
222                        }
223                }
224                
225                public static PntInt from(java.awt.Point p) {
226                        return new PntInt(p.x, p.y);
227                }
228                
229                // static conversion methods
230                
231                public int[] toIntArray() {
232                        return new int[] {this.x, this.y};
233                }
234                
235                public java.awt.Point toAwtPoint() {
236                        return new java.awt.Point(this.x, this.y);
237                }
238        }
239}
